snippet: The Labor Department said its Consumer Price Index gained 0.1 percent as a rebound in gasoline prices was partly offset by a drop in the cost of food.
abstract: Labor Dept reports its Consumer Price Index rose 0.1 percent in March, compared with 0.2 percent drop in February; reports initial claims for state unemployment benefits fell 13,000 to seasonally adjusted 253,000 for week ended April 9.
lead_paragraph: The Labor Department said its Consumer Price Index gained 0.1 percent as a rebound in gasoline prices was partly offset by a drop in the cost of food.

headline.main: Consumer Prices Barely Ticked Up in March
headline.print_headline: Consumer Prices Rose in March, Just Barely
